tag_professor: TEST HEAVY (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
stu_tags: LECTURE HEAVY  SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.  TEST HEAVY
comments: The powerpoints are so bad. Write notes as he talks. That is the only way you\'ll get all the info. Watch all the videos before tests. I found that the best way to memorize. Attendance will boost your grade 5%, as long as you attend 95% of the time. You have to study hard because tests grades are the only grades.

tag_professor: TEST HEAVY (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: This class was very frustrating. Pay very close attention to the youtube videos, go to class and listen closely, and finally do NOT buy the book! The comprehensive final is 50% of your grade.

tag_professor: TEST HEAVY (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: Not wonderful, not bad. Make sure to go to class and take notes; study the power points he posts on BB. Lectures can drag on if you are not huge into music.

tag_professor: TEST HEAVY (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: Class based strckly on YouTube and his PP slides. He gets side-tracked very easily and goes off on tangents about random facts of knowledge. He can be unclear sometimes which makes the tests more difficult. His syllibus is basically worthless. Work in teams to accomplish the work.

tag_professor: TEST HEAVY (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: Although you have to retain some unnecessary information, you would do well if you pay attention to the videos (Youtube is your friend) and instruments. Be careful on the tests since there are few unimportant questions. Textbooks= not really necessary, but try to listen to CDs. Print pp out before class as guideline.

tag_professor: TEST HEAVY (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: He is a very dedicated professor. He lectures a lot but most of the time he explains everything clearly. He also loves to show videos to help you understand what the instrument sounds, and looks like. As long as you can remember the instruments, sounds, origins, look, and pay attention in class you should do just fine.

tag_professor: TEST HEAVY (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: He\'s a very nice guy, very willing to help. Yes, his expectations are high but not unreasonable. Attendance is a must to get the notes needed for the tests. Know the name, sound, origin, appearance, function, and construction of EVERY instrument discussed and you\'ll be fine.

tag_professor: TEST HEAVY (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: Super duper nice and respectful to the students. No study guide and the test could cover virtually anything lectured on, listened to watched, etc. Way too much info too retain for non music majors. I got an A but it was very very hard!

tag_professor: TEST HEAVY (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: His tests are terrible, the syllabus is a JOKE, and all he talks about are drums. This was the worst class I have EVER taken! It was SUPER boring and ABSOLUTELY POINTLESS! I learned nothing. He is a great guy, but a TERRIBLE professor! DO NOT TAKE A CLASS FROM HIM IF YOU LIKE YOUR 4.0!

tag_professor: TEST HEAVY (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: I really love music, but this guy made it seem so boring. It\'s all lecture-based and the test questions were rediculous. He even made us go to 2 orchestra\'s and write about them...
